comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Other Bain/LOC photos of visiting British Suffragette leader Emmeline Pankhurst, addressing (or attempting to address) a noisy, rowdy crowd by the Subtreasury Building in Wall Street, New York City, on November 27, 1911:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163793234/in/photostream/]
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2423482538/]
In the vehicle with Mrs. Pankhurst were Hariot Stanton Blatch, U. S. Suffragist leader, and the venerable Dr. Anna Howard Shaw.

Mrs. Pankhurst made a return visit to America in October, 1913. On that occasion, foolish U. S. immigration officials decided to bar entry to her, holding her at Ellis Island for deportation. This created a cause celebre, and required the personal intervention of U. S. President Woodrow Wilson to admit her for an already-scheduled lecture tour. The publicity helped suffragist fundraising enormously.

comment.author: 11773531@N07
comment._content: Wow! I love this photo (and the one from Wystan-that is another excellent shot).  Thank you parkermulligan for that NY Times article!
